column3: Creating, testing, and delivering value with greater speed and frequency
column4: Although it started as a software engineering concept, it has been sucessfuly applied to a broader concept of value delivery

column3: Continuous Delivery is the ability to get changes of all types into the hands of users, safely and quickly in a sustainable way.
column4: This includies new features, configuration changes, bug fixes and experiments

column3:
Low Risk Releases
Faster Time to Market
Higher Quality
Lower Costs
Better Products
Happier Teams
It’s about continuous, daily improvement—the constant discipline of pursuing higher performance
column4: Follow the heuristic 'if it hurts, do it more often, and bring the pain forward.”

column3: How do you transform your organization to ensure sustainable results?
column4: This model gives structure and understanding to the implementation of Continuous Delivery and its core components.

column3: Key aspects to consider when implementing Continuous Delivery

column4: The organization and it’s culture are probably the most important aspects to consider when aiming to create a sustainable Continuous Delivery environment that takes advantage of all the resulting effects.

The design and architecture of your products and services will have an essential impact on your ability to adopt continuous delivery. If a system is built with continuous delivery principles and a rapid release mind set from the beginning, the journey will be much smoother.

Build and deployment is of course core to Continuous Delivery and this is where a lot of tools and automation come into the pipeline; this is what is most is commonly perceived when Continuous Delivery is discussed.
Testing is  an absolutely crucial part of a successful implementation of Continuous Delivery.
You cannot manage any process without information. Practices in this category give feedback to the team on the effectivness of the process and quality of the value delivered.
Teams get points for adopted practices
This assessment is for a real team
